Articles.Content:
This is my recent creation for a fighter jet, and I'm pretty proud. It is super agile and very cool looking. You don't have to use any mods to fly it, so it completely works with stock KSP. I just use Kerbpaint and horockets for better looks. Its vtol, too Action group 1 toggles vtol engines, and action group 2 toggles horizontal flight engine. Hover is just about above 1/3 throttle for vtol engines.

Here's the download:

http://www./view/1g3o5xxis6981f6/Fighter__Ataraxia_.craft

Sorry for bad english, its not my first language

If you like my design, I have other planes on this [thread=90305]post[/thread]
This looks really cool! rep for you, good sir

This looks really cool! rep for you, good sir

Thanks man, I appreciate it.
Very cool! Reminds me of a lot of modern day and Mareczex333's creations. What mod are you using to track both fighters! I still don't know...

How did you get that other plane to fly around???

The plane overall looks awesome. I just can't figure out how you make the plane look like its defying gravity sometimes like being upside down. Yeah like at 4:14 your plane was still flying even though you turned off your engines???

Edited August 16, 2014 by Brody Peffley

Very cool! Reminds me of a lot of modern day and Mareczex333's creations. What mod are you using to track both fighters! I still don't know...

The mod is called persistent trails. Check it out out

How did you get that other plane to fly around???

The plane overall looks awesome. I just can't figure out how you make the plane look like its defying gravity sometimes like being upside down. Yeah like at 4:14 your plane was still flying even though you turned off your engines???

I didn't hack gravity because I crashed O.o. The plane has like 4 delta wings with like 8 little winglets on them and only on some I have roll enabled and thats it. having so many wings gives you and insane glide-slope; the plane could glide at 14 m/s

also it kind of touched the ground, but it was moving at very slow speeds so the wings didn't break, but it pitched to plane back into air. It takes a lot of attempts skill to get that working

Edited August 17, 2014 by manni01
I definitely like the design. Thanks for sharing the Ataraxia with us, Manni.
Thanks for the complement. I'm rendering my aerial docking video right now, its gonna be up soon.
